content:
https://patientdave.blogspot.com/2009/03/comprehending-us-healthcare-budget.htmlimage.png
Back at the very beginning of my odyssey, I started pondering the magnitude of the numbers in the US health system. Finding the visualization in this post was a turning point; as it says,

I'm not waiting for the system to reform itself: I think we need to get busy at building our own solutions. The system may well improve, which is fine, but I ain't waitin' for it.

And since then the magnitude of the spending has grown more than 50%.

The importance of building our own solutions is clearer than ever.

I get

Sorry, the page you were looking for in this blog does not exist.

You have successfully created the issue (NEWID-3008), however you do not have the permission to view the created issue.

You cannot view this URL as a guest. You must log in .

If you think you shouldn't get this message, please contact your Jira administrators.
That's normal. You just need to wait for someone to review and approve. (Which I just did :smile: )
:pray::pray::pray::pray:
How subscribe all calendar meetings in one Google calendar

Lloyd McKenzie said:

That's normal. You just need to wait for someone to review and approve. (Which I just did :smile: )

Suggestion: it would be nice if the message TOLD the person "this is normal. You just need to wait..." :smile:

@Dave deBronkart If I knew how to do that, I would...
@Chandrakant Bhoslay The HL7 meetings can be seen here: http://www.hl7.org/concalls/CallDirectory.aspx. (I'd be cautious about adding all of them to your calendar :)

Dear All,
Who like to use telegram as a chat option for work group meetings update:
